oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 2nd Arkansas Inf. Regt. Button
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This rare, relic Arkansas infantry button was found near Appleton where Gen. Hood's forces fought a rear-guard action during the Dec. 1864 retreat from Middle Tennessee. It was manufactured by Casimir Rouyer of New Orleans and is "considered one of the most desirable of all pre-1865 Southern state buttons." Brass with raised relief "2d ARK R. CSA."
